reviews.review_msg: Amazing Professor. Loves to answer questions and support your learning. Makes 100% fair tests. Actually cares about his students learning. Nice guy.

Great Professor! He had very clear lectures, good notes and the exams didn't have any surprises. He was caring and super easy to get ahold of. He seemed very passionate about mental health and addiction which added to the course. You don't need to buy the textbook. For exams there is a lot of memorization required but nothing too difficult.

Had Will for Health Science 214 and he was AWESOME. The course itself was interesting and his attitude and just his fun lecturing demeanour was out of this world. If I could take another course with him, I for sure would. He is also very accessible outside of class and replies fast to emails. Genuinely a caring prof.

cant count how many times i fell asleep but i still loved the lectures and him as a prof. he is very interested in the topic of the lectures. saving you $80, dont buy the textbook. his notes are long but i enjoyed reading them. really nice guy. 10/10! will take your upper division class! see you there!

he actually cares about the students and tries to help them succeed in the course. content was interesting and tutorial was actually very useful (shoutout jeanine). everything was easy until the final exam which tanked my grade. definitely recommend this course

Extremely lecture heavy course, if you want to get an A you have to study weeks prior to the midterm/final. Lectures are extremely info dense and are mostly just words on a white background making it hard to follow. I will say professor Small was easily accessible outside of class times and was incredibly helpful before exams, always responsive.
Solid professor, extremely nice person. class is content heavy though

It was my first time taking a course with Dr. Small and I can see why others have taken multiple courses with him. His lectures were interesting, relevant, and enjoyable as he was genuinely passionate about the content and incorporated interesting in-class activities to complement the learning materials. I learned so much from this class!
Best prof I've ever had. Incredibly kind, caring, and approachable. I learned so much from this course and would 100% take a course with him again!

He is one of the best professors you can ask for. He cares about his students and is willing to make adjustments to help students be successful in his course. The lecture is quite dry, but all the information on the slides is the exam content. Clearly explained everything before moving onto the next topic. Highly recommend his class10000%

Dr. Small is probably one of the best profs in the department. Super nice and approachable. Lecture heavy but very easy to understand. He values students time and is honestly the most caring prof ever. Goes above and beyond to make sure that everything is clear and comfortable for students.

Will is the best, I would take every course with him if I could. He is so caring towards students and always happy to accommodate any needs if you ask. Lectures are all based off the readings, midterm and quizzes are easy to do good on if you review the lectures. Always nice to take a course with a prof who is passionate about the topic!

William is the best, please take a class with him and enjoy learning about a topic that is actually interesting and relevant to public health. He cares a lot for his students and is always trying to communicate with them. I have never had a prof who actually listens to students concerns and wants to make thing easy for them. He is truly a gem.

A great prof, through and through. Dr. Small made it his goal to be kind and create a welcoming environment in his classes. He tends to fall a bit behind in his lectures but it is so obvious he loves teaching and wants students to succeed. Super accessible after class and by email and makes sure you feel respected and heard!

Will is awesome! I thoroughly enjoyed his class, thought the material was comprehensive & interesting, assignments were relevant to our future practice & fairly graded, and lectures were engaging. 10/10, would take a class with him any time.

He cares a lot about his student and he tries to create a very respectful learning environment for his student. His lecture is fun and I really love his way of presenting the materials in class. All the content are basically on the lecture slides. One of the best professor I have ever had, highly recommended every class with him!!!

Favourite prof at SFU so far. Truly caring and accommodating, speaks very respectfully and encourages ALL questions and comments. You can tell he is very passionate at what he does. Lectures are info dense and you could get a decent grade with only the slides, A- and above will require textbook readings

Dr. Small is a real gem. One of the best profs at SFU, and one of the best human beings Ive ever met. Super understanding and caring, and he really wants his students to do well. I highly recommend taking a class with him.

Dr Small is probably the best prof I've had at SFU so far, he is so caring and obviously passionate about the course content which makes it more interesting for students. Lectures were dense at times but enjoyable. Assignments were straightforward, he was really accommodating and happy to help. Definitely recommend taking a class with him!
Dr. Will is caring, understanding and really cares about his students. His lectures are straight forward but you definitely have to read the textbook for his exams. Overall, great professor

Will understands the struggle of a student balancing many courses and is very willing to extend deadlines. His course covers 2(!!) textbooks so be prepared to read. He does a solid job of engaging the class in discussions. The main assessments are 2 papers with a limited page requirement so be succinct and dont ramble. Definitely would recommend.

Small is one of the most understanding professors Ive ever had. He is very accommodating, extending deadlines b/c we felt overwhelmed with our other classes. He values feedback and does his best to implement any changes. Class is very content heavy/lecture slides are dense. Midterms are papers. get ready to read. A lot. Group project involved.

Will is one of the most understanding and nicest professors I've ever had. His slides are very informative yet dense. He extended deadlines for assignments multiple times which I really appreciate. He really values feedback and always try to accommodate to students' needs. The papers are a pain but bearable. There is a group assignment so beware

Material is interesting, however it is easy to get lost as there is a ton of it covered. Group project can be a struggle depending on what group members you have. Everything is essay based so get ready to write.
